channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Great British bond battering continues after budget speech
item.description: U.K. bond yields continued to surge on Friday, as fixed-income investors react in dismay to an increase in issuance.

item.title: Credit and Debit Cards Ate Cash. So What's Eating Cards?
item.description: Card payments in the U.S. are no longer growing twice as fast as personal consumption: What that means for the business of plastic

item.title: Why a possible spinoff of Comcast’s cable networks is drawing cheers

item.title: You Bought Blockbuster I Bonds. Here's What to Do With Them Now.
item.description: The interest rate on new I bonds fell to about 3% as of Nov. 1.

item.title: Base Metals Broadly Stable With U.S. Election in Focus
item.description: Base metals were broadly stable in early European trade as a lack of strong directional appetite have kept prices supported within this week’s range, ...

item.title: ‘I became very frugal’: My husband and I are 40. I have $200,000 in student debt, while he has $600,000 in retirement savings. Are we in trouble?
item.description: “Neither of us will have an inheritance and everything we have, we built together.”

item.title: Sterling Stabilizes After Post-Budget Falls

item.title: Abbott Labs and Reckitt Benckiser shares surge on court’s baby formula ruling
item.description: A court in St. Louis, Missouri ruled in favor of Abbott Laboratories and Reckitt Benckiser over claims their specialized baby formula caused users to ...

item.title: Real-estate agents on how they handle haunted homes in an already-scary housing market
item.description: This Halloween, real-estate agents reflect on some of the creepiest, spookiest homes they’ve helped buy or sell — or lived in themselves.

item.title: Amazon Keeps Profit Margins in Orbit
item.description: The e-commerce giant’s strong operating earnings are offsetting a huge jump in AI spending and countering worries of declining margins.
